words.description: A fruit that is typically round and red, green, or yellow.
A long, curved fruit with a yellow skin and soft, sweet, white flesh inside.
A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractable claws.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, and barking, howling, or whining.
A large herbivorous mammal with a trunk and tusks, native to Africa and Asia.
The part of a plant that is often brightly colored and produces seeds or fruit.
A stringed musical instrument with a long neck and usually six strings.
A building for human habitation, especially one that is lived in by a family or small group of people.
A sweet frozen food made from milk or cream and typically flavored with vanilla, chocolate, or fruit.
A piece of clothing worn on the upper body outside, usually with sleeves and fastened with buttons or a zipper.
A light framework covered with paper, cloth, or plastic, designed to be flown in the air at the end of a long string.
A large wild cat with a tawny coat, a tufted tail, and a mane in males, native to Africa and northwestern India.
A small to medium-sized primate with a long tail and a prehensile tail or hands, known for its agility and playful nature.
A book of blank pages for writing or drawing in.
A citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind and sweet juicy pulp.
An instrument for writing or drawing, consisting of a thin stick of graphite or a similar substance enclosed in a wooden or plastic casing.
The female ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.
A multicolored arc made by light striking water droplets, often seen in the sky after rain.
The star around which the earth orbits, providing light and warmth.
A large wild cat with a striped coat, native to Asia.
A device used for protection against rain or sun, consisting of a collapsible canopy mounted on a central rod.
A wooden string instrument played with a bow, typically having four strings.
A large, green fruit with a sweet, juicy, red or pink flesh and black seeds.
A musical instrument with a series of wooden bars struck by mallets.
A medium-sized sailing boat equipped for cruising or racing.
An African wild horse with black and white stripes.
A powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces.
A vehicle composed of two wheels held in a frame one behind the other, powered by pedaling.
A food made from roasted and ground cacao seeds, used as a flavoring or sweetener.
A marine mammal known for its intelligence and playful behavior.
A large mammal with a trunk, native to Africa and Asia.
A small to medium-sized omnivorous mammal with a bushy tail and pointed snout.
A tall African mammal with a very long neck and legs, and a distinctive coat pattern.
A head covering often worn for protection, fashion, or as part of a uniform.
A piece of land completely surrounded by water.
A marine animal with a gelatinous, transparent body and stinging tentacles.
A large marsupial from Australia with powerful hind legs and a long tail.
A yellow, acidic fruit used in cooking and drinks.
A large natural elevation of the earth's surface rising abruptly from the surrounding level.
A type of pasta made from wheat or rice flour and water, often used in Asian cuisine.
A sea creature with eight long arms and a soft body.
A large bear-like mammal with distinctive black and white fur, native to China.
A warm bed covering made of padding enclosed between layers of fabric.
A vehicle or device propelled by expelling gas or other matter.
A fixed luminous point in the night sky that is a large, remote incandescent body like the sun.
A series of connected railroad cars pulled or pushed by one or more locomotives.
A device used for protection from rain or sun.
A string instrument played with a bow, typically having four strings.
An opening in a wall or roof for allowing light or air to enter and usually having glass.
A semi-solid sourish food made from milk fermented by added bacteria.
